result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M. Beasley-Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation is CONSECUTIVE to the Sentence in Walworth County Case 2014CF000275

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------------

No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim.
------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------------------------

Defendant Michael M. Beasley-Hart in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michael M. Beasley-Hart in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session at 2:30 pm. Appearances made. Haley Johnson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Rebbecca Hammock appears with defendant. Atty Hammock makes a correction to the PSI. Victim makes statement. Exhibit #1-#5 moved into evidence. Victims mother makes statement. 2:44 pm Atty Johnson makes statement regarding sentence recommended. 2:59 pm  Atty Hammock makes statement regarding sentence. 3:07 pm  Mr. Beasley-Hart makes statement. 3:17 pm  Victims mother makes statement. Court takes break and will resume at 3:45 pm. 
Court back in session at 3:45 pm. Court goes over sentence.

Extended Supervision -  2 years
